lines.text: [Fuzzy consults a crystal ball]
Oh, Big Chiefs in the Clouds, speak to me... Don't somebody want to speak to me?
Sure. Me talk.
W-W-Who are you?
Me Chief Standing Pine.
W-W-Where-Where are you standing, Pine?
Right beside you, Paleface!
Say, Fuzzy, maybe that Indian pal of yours could tell you where to dig a little gold dust on this claim.
Oh, ah, ain't you found nothin' yet?
Not enough to fill a gnat's tooth.
Listen! I ain't killed a guy in over a week and I wouldn't trust you with myself if I was you. Now get out of here!
[believing Fuzzy to be psychic, the townsmen consult him about future events]
Oh, Mr. Jones, when would be a good time to sell my crops?
Oh, about the first.
The first of what?
The first chance you get!
[through his crystal ball, Fuzzy consults with the spirit of Chief Standing Pine]
Okay. Okay. Trance over. Standing Pine...
Standing Pine! Standing Pine! I gotta a couple of things I want to tell you... I wonder if he belongs to the union.
Hey, wait a minute boys - don't crowd me! I'm formin' a big organization and you're all welcome as soon as things get ripe.
[Joe and Ralph comment from the fringes of the throng]
Yeah, and when it is, we'll be on hand to pick the plum.
Provided that Billy Carson doesn't upset the apple cart.
I'm in the blue chips this time, proper. You and me is practically millionaires.
Yeah, whadja do? Make a strike of fool's gold?
Well, you can include me out. I haven't got 50,000 dollars to be buying gold mines from crazy people.
Standing Pine told me where I could find this big claim.
Standing Pine? Who's Standing Pine?
He's my Indian guide. He's a spirit.
A spirit. Fuzz, you better keep that cork in the bottle. Those spirits are going to get you in trouble.
I'm going to go, Fuzz. When that lynching party gets ready to singe your whiskers, you can call for me.
